docs.lead_paragraph: Doctors operating their own in-office pharmacies are raising the costs for insurance companies, employers and taxpayers.

headline.seo: Some Doctors Cash In by Being Their Own Pharmacist
headline.main: Insurers Pay Big Markups as Doctors Dispense Drugs
headline.print_headline: Drugs Dispensed By Doctors Cost Insurers Dearly

docs.abstract: Rules in some states that govern workers' compensation insurance allow doctors to dispense drugs at a large markup directly from their office rather than having patients go through a pharmacy; experts say through the practice, doctors, middlemen and drug distributors are adding hundreds of millions of dollars annually to the costs borne by taxpayers, insurance companies and employers.
docs.snippet: Doctors operating their own in-office pharmacies are raising the costs for insurance companies, employers and taxpayers.

byline.original: By BARRY MEIER and KATIE THOMAS

docs.lead_paragraph: A single company purchased more than 50,000 Hewlett-Packard computers last year, buying in bulk to shave millions of dollars off its costs. But it was not General Electric, Procter & Gamble or another large, multinational conglomerate with the muscle to dictate prices to suppliers. Rather, the big buyer was the Blackstone Group, a private equity firm.
docs.abstract: Giant private equity firms like Blackstone Group have discovered they gain purchasing power and save money when buying supplies for all their companies in bulk; they are using their size and scope to pressure suppliers, set their own prices and exert their influence in a range of industries, including health care, construction and consumer goods. Photos (M)
docs.snippet: A single company purchased more than 50,000 Hewlett-Packard computers last year, buying in bulk to shave millions of dollars off its costs.     But it was not General Electric, Procter & Gamble or another large, multinational conglomerate with the...

headline.main: Private Equity Giants Use Size to Lean on Suppliers

docs.abstract: Private equity firms like the Blackstone Group, which collectively oversee thousands of companies, are using their size and scope to pressure suppliers, set their own prices and exert their influence in a range of industries.
docs.snippet: Private equity firms like the Blackstone Group, which collectively oversee thousands of companies, are using their size and scope to pressure suppliers, set their own prices and exert their influence in a range of industries.

headline.main: Does the Government Cause or Prevent Wildfires?

docs.abstract: Has the government played a role in increasing the risk of these fires? Can government policies prevent them?
docs.snippet: Has the government played a role in increasing the risk of these fires? Can government policies prevent them?

headline.main: Do You Really Want to Be a Business Owner?

docs.abstract: Here’s my list of the pros and cons of owning a business. But when I made my career choice, I didn’t need to make lists — starting a business was the only thing I wanted to do.
docs.snippet: Here’s my list of the pros and cons of owning a business. But when I made my career choice, I didn’t need to make lists — starting a business was the only thing I wanted to do.

docs.lead_paragraph: Our democracy, a miraculous gathering of diverse players, needs participants to play fair.

headline.seo: Obama the Socialist? Not Even Close
headline.main: Obama the Socialist? Not Even Close
headline.print_headline: Obama the Socialist? Not Even Close

docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by filmmaker Milos Forman disputes those who accuse Pres Obama of being a socialist; contends that such claims cheapen the experience of millions who lived and continue to live under brutal forms of socialism.
docs.snippet: Our democracy, a miraculous gathering of diverse players, needs participants to play fair.

headline.main: Having Lost the Health Care Battle, the N.F.I.B. Readies for a Long War

docs.abstract: Acknowledging that full repeal is a long shot, the group seems to have settled on a less ambitious course of stripping the law of the elements it considers most odious.

docs.lead_paragraph: Gov. Rick Perry told federal officials on Monday that Texas would not expand Medicaid or create an insurance exchange.

headline.seo: Perry Says Texas Rejects Health Law ‘Intrusions’
headline.main: Perry Declares Texas’ Rejection of Health Care Law ‘Intrusions’
headline.print_headline: Perry Declares Texas’ Rejection of Health Care Law ‘Intrusions’

docs.abstract: Gov Rick Perry of Texas tells federal officials that the state has no intention of expanding Medicaid or establishing a health insurance exchange, two major provisions of the health care reform law.
docs.snippet: Gov. Rick Perry told federal officials on Monday that Texas would not expand Medicaid or create an insurance exchange.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama and top Republicans made politically charged proposals on Monday on tax cuts and health care, but each side risked opening fissures in their own ranks.

headline.seo: In Framing Touchy Election Issues, Party Leaders Take Risks
headline.main: Parties’ Tactics Eroding Unity Left and Right
headline.print_headline: Dissent in the Ranks as Parties’ Tactics Erode Unity Both Left and Right

docs.abstract: Pres Obama's proposal to extend tax cuts for people earning under $250,000 for one year and plan by Congressional Republicans to vote on a repeal of the health care reform law may risk putting each side at odds with others in their own parties; divisions underscore the stakes the president and Republicans face as they battle for control of the election-year political debate.
docs.snippet: President Obama and top Republicans made politically charged proposals on Monday on tax cuts and health care, but each side risked opening fissures in their own ranks.
